name: Dichloro(difluoro)methane
Reason: The basic unit, methane, has a melting point of -182.5 degrees Celsius. Adding halogens generally increases the molecular weight and intermolecular forces, particularly dipole-dipole interactions and London dispersion forces, thus raising the melting point. Chlorines contribution to raising the melting point can be estimated to be +15 degrees Celsius per atom, due to its size and electron-withdrawing nature. Fluorines effect could be estimated to be around +5 degrees Celsius per atom due to its smaller size compared to chlorine but strong electronegativity which contributes to dipole-dipole interactions. There are two of each halogen, so the cumulative effect of all four halogens would be (2 * 15) + (2 * 5) = 40 degrees Celsius.

name: Dichloro(difluoro)methane
Reason: The basic unit, methane, has a melting point of -182 degrees Celsius. Adding halogens generally increases the melting point due to higher molecular weight and enhanced intermolecular forces. Each chlorine is estimated to raise the melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to its larger atomic size and significant contribution to van der Waals and dipole-dipole interactions. Each fluorine is expected to increase the melting point by about +10 degrees Celsius because of its strong electronegativity and contribution to dipole-dipole interactions despite its smaller size compared to chlorine. With two chlorine atoms and two fluorine atoms, their combined effects would be (2 * 20) + (2 * 10) = 60 degrees Celsius.

name: Dichloro(difluoro)methane
Reason: The basic unit, methane, has a melting point of -182.5 degrees Celsius. Chlorine substituents increase the melting point because of the higher molecular weight and increased polarizability, which allows for better packing in the solid state. Each chlorine might add approximately +10 degrees Celsius. Fluorine substituents also increase the melting point due to the higher electronegativity and the strong dipole-dipole interactions they introduce. Each fluorine might add roughly +2 degrees Celsius given its smaller size and effect compared to chlorine.
